TopicTitle: [1.2] PlanetShine - v0.2.5.2 stable - v0.5 experimental [4 October 2016]

Articles.Content: anyone got any good settings. i cant seem to adjust it very good
update for latest ksp version?
It works. If you want the warning to go away (its just a warning, the mod works with 1.0.4), look in the last pages, some info is there.

It works. If you want the warning to go away (its just a warning, the mod works with 1.0.4), look in the last pages, some info is there.

Read the last 20 pages and can find no actual steps to make the warning go away, except for editing the version.txt file, which does not work. I have 1.04. Does anyone have a method to get the warning to go away? "Unsupported KSP version... Please use 1.02". Every other mod I have you can fix this by editing the version file, but there must be something deeper in this mod?
Removing MiniAVC (dll and config) did it for me...
From reading above, PlanetShine works in 1.0.4, but you have to remove MiniAVC to get it to stop yelling at you that it doesn't work, Yes?
that, or open up the .version file in the PlanetShine/Plugins folder in a text editor and change both the KSP_VERSION PATCH fields to 4. Or maybe just one or the other. I forget

I'm not sure if planetshine would do this, but I'm asking to see if anyone else has had this issue. My atmosphere on Kerbin is gone, as in, all i see is a black sky with a sun, as though I were on the mun. Has anyone else experienced this? Is there a fix? Is it even planetshine?

TheDoctor;2160214']Is it even planetshine?

remove it from GameData and find out
Would be nicew to have support from city lights. The effect from them shold be quite noticeable.

remove it from GameData and find out

The simplest solution is always the best..... turns out it was scatterer.

Really like the effect planetshine has on the game Valerian, subtle but has a big impact and is one of the things that helps the likes of Proot make their amazing Visual packs for the game (Proots work brought me here ), Do you have a paypal donate so I can buy you a beer?

By the way, Thanks for posting that Mitch, that is just such an amazing sight, Don't they charter flights just to see eclipses like that? Would love to go on one some day :-)

Would it be possible for a future release to add eclipse shadows? Right now eclipses block solar power but don't block the actual light reaching a planet/spacecraft.

http://i.imgur.com/YKpGe6U.gif
Is there an ETA on when this is going to be updated?
It works, Sampa. There is only a warning, which you can change in the version file. The only bugs are with EVE's city lights. And if you already know this, then... oh well.
ok, because I just crashed my game!

ok, because I just crashed my game!

Then you did something wrong. WHAT DID YOU DO SAMPA?! WHAT DID YOU- I cannot keep a straight face for that one.

Be a little more descriptive with the nature of the crash. Nobody can help you otherwise.

Note: I am on Win64 so disregard this if you don't support it.

Does "Ground and atmosphere ambient light intensity" do anything? Moving it back and forth at the launchpad seems to do absolutely nothing, no matter what "ground ambient light override" is set to. The vacuum ambient light level *does* affect the light intensity on the launchpad, though!

Also the "Reset" button for Ground ambient fade altitude under advanced doesn't always seem to reset, and I'm not sure it's resetting to the actual default values.

Edited September 17, 2015 by Glyph

This mod is beautiful. I think much of it's beauty is in its unobtrusive subtlety. The gentle blue cast on the ship as it begins re-entry to Kerbin makes my visual cortex very happy.

Great mod.
